newsitem.title: RUSSIA: UES shares rise 12.6 pct on ADR rumours.
newsitem.headline: UES shares rise 12.6 pct on ADR rumours.

text.p: Shares of national electric company UES had risen 12.6 percent on the Russian Trading System at 0800 GMT on rumours that the company would issue American Depositary Receipts soon, traders said on Monday.
"The market is certainly pricing in the imminent launch of an ADR," said one trader.
RAO UES shares had risen to $0.3150 from $0.2798 at the close on Thursday, the previous trading day for the Russian market. UES preferred shares had risen to $0.2149 from $0.1957.
Leading shares were bullish on Monday morning after a three-day market holiday and traders said volumes were looking healthy.
UES was rumoured to be readying an American Depositary Receipt, which would allow trading of shares on foreign exchanges, in Regulation S format, which requires relatively little documentation.
UES shares had not broken the 30 cent barrier before and traded at about eight cents last December.
